sourceMeaningMnemonic: I found <radical>part</radical> of a <radical>plate</radical> at the <kanji>lantern festival</kanji>, and put it on a <kanji>tray</kanji> to keep it safe. There is a legendary plate broken into three parts. One part of the plate I found was at the lantern festival. The lantern festival was pretty cool, but I’m really glad I found the part of that plate I was looking for.
meaningInfo: Imagine holding a tray in your hands with this part of the plate on it, as the light from the lanterns glitters off it and dances around, illuminating the background. It’s enchanting.
readingMnemonic: The plate part you found at the <kanji>lantern festival</kanji> (and put on the <kanji>tray</kanji>) is made out of <reading>bone</reading> (<ja>ぼん</ja>) china. How fancy. Is bone china made from real bones? Bones found in China? Probably not, huh.
readingInfo: Tap this bone china plate with your knuckle. Hear the pleasant tap as you continue to view all the fancy lanterns around you at the festival.
